SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.imap

Class ImapClient

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.imap.ImapClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class ImapClient extends Object implements AutoCloseable
Lightweight IMAP helper used by tests and utilities to fetch messages from a mailbox.

This class is intentionally small and focused: it connects to an IMAP server using Jakarta Mail, opens a folder (defaults to INBOX), and exposes convenience methods to fetch all messages or search for a message by its Message-ID header.

Usage example: 

 try (ImapClient client = new ImapClient("imap.example.com", 993, "user", "pass")) {
     List messages = client.fetchEmails();
 Message m = client.fetchEmailByMessageId("<abc@example.com>");
 }

Notes: - Port 993 will enable SSL for Jakarta Mail by default. - The client implements AutoCloseable so it can be used in try-with-resources blocks.

  • Method Details

    • buildProperties

      private Properties buildProperties()
      Builds Jakarta Mail session properties for IMAP/IMAPS.

    • fetchEmails

      public List<jakarta.mail.Message> fetchEmails()
      Fetches all emails from the configured folder.

      On error the method logs the exception and returns an empty list.

      Returns:
      List of Messages (possibly empty). Never returns null.

    • fetchEmailByMessageId

      public jakarta.mail.Message fetchEmailByMessageId(String messageId)
      Fetches an email by its Message-ID header.

      The search is a simple linear scan over the messages returned by fetchEmails(). Header comparison is done using String.contains() to allow matching with or without surrounding angle brackets.

      Parameters:
      messageId - The Message-ID to search for (for example: "<abc@example.com>").
      Returns:
      The Message if found, otherwise null.

    • close

      public void close() throws Exception
